data_manager module

class data_manager.DataHandler(verbose: int = 1)[source]

Bases: ABC

A class for managing nested dictionary and list structures with abstract methods for getting, setting, and iterating over elements.

delete(data: Dict | list, idx: str | int) → None[source]

Delete an item from a dictionary or list.

Parameters:

  • data (Dict or list) – The data structure to modify.

  • idx (str or int) – The key (for dict) or index (for list) to delete.

Raises:

  • TypeError – If the data type is unsupported.

  • KeyError – If the key is not found in a dictionary.

  • IndexError – If the index is out of range for a list.

insert(data_list: list, idx: int, item: Any) → None[source]

Insert an item into a list at the specified index.

Parameters:

  • data_list (list) – The list to modify.

  • idx (int) – The index to insert the item.

  • item (Any) – The item to insert.

Raises:

  • ValueError – If the data is not a list.

  • IndexError – If the index is out of range.

items(data: Dict | list) → Iterator[source]

Return an iterator over key-value or index-value pairs.

replace_indirect(data: Dict, key: str) → str | None[source]

Resolve indirect key references in a string.

Parameters:

  • data (Dict) – Dictionary containing potential indirect references.

  • key (str) – The key to resolve.

Returns:

The resolved key, or None if the reference could not be resolved.

Return type:

Union[str, None]

Notes

  • If the key is not a string, it is returned as is.

  • If the key contains ‘@’ for indirect references, it tries to resolve the reference.

warn(message: str) → None[source]

Print a warning message if verbosity is enabled.

class data_manager.DataManager(verbose=1)[source]

Bases: ABC

Base class for managing data, providing functions for: load, save, get, set, and undo.

Subclasses are created for specific file formats and must support: _load_data and _save_data.

_data

The main data structure being managed (dictionary or list).

Type:

Union[Dict, List]

file_path

Path to the file associated with the data.

Type:

str

directory

Directory containing the file.

Type:

str

unsaved_changes

Indicates if there are unsaved changes in the data.

Type:

bool

snapshots

Stack of snapshots for supporting undo functionality.

Type:

List

max_snapshots

Maximum number of snapshots retained for undo operations.

Type:

int

proxy_mapping

Maps keys to proxy files for granular build system dependencies.

type:

Dict

Methods:

add_proxy(proxy_file, proxy_update_keys)[source]

Add a proxy file and its associated update keys. If any of these keys are updated, they will trigger a touch to this proxy_file. This can be used to improve the granularity of dependencies for build management systems. The build system can set a dependency on the proxy_file which is only updated for a subset of fields in the config file rather than rebuilding from any change to the config file.

Parameters:

  • proxy_file (str) – The file to touch when any associated key is updated.

  • proxy_update_keys (List[str]) – List of keys that trigger a touch to this proxy_file.

create(data: Dict[str, Any])[source]

Create a new config file with the specified data.

Parameters:

data (Dict[str, Any]) – Data to save in the new file.

delete(key)[source]

Remove an item from the data.

Parameters:

key – Key or index of the item to remove.

get(key_or_index, default=None)[source]

Retrieve a value from the data, returning a default if not found.

Parameters:

  • key_or_index – Key or index for the data.

  • default – Default value to return if the key or index is not found.

Returns:

The value associated with the key or index, or the default.

get_open_mode(write=False)[source]

Provides the file mode for the data file. Default is ‘w’ for write mode, ‘r’ for read mode. Override for binary or other modes.

Parameters:

write (bool) – Whether the file is being opened for writing.

Returns:

‘w’ for write mode, ‘r’ for read mode.

Return type:

str

init_data(data: Dict[str, Any] | List[Any])[source]

Initialize the data

Parameters:

data (Dict[str, Any]) – New data to initialize.

insert(key, value)[source]

Insert a new item into the data.

Parameters:

  • key – Key or index for the new item.

  • value – Value to insert.

items()[source]

Get an iterator over the items in the data.

Returns:

An iterator over the data items.

Return type:

Iterator

load(path)[source]

Load data from the specified file and initialize state. Create an initial snapshot for undo functionality.

Parameters:

path (str) – Path to the file to load.

Returns:

True if the file was loaded successfully.

Return type:

bool

Raises:

  • FileNotFoundError – If the file does not exist.

  • IOError – If there is an issue reading the file.

  • ValueError – If the file contents are invalid.

save()[source]

Save the current data to the file if it has been modified. Create a snapshot of the data for undo feature.

Returns:

True if the file was saved successfully.

Return type:

bool

Raises:

ValueError – If the file path or data is None.

set(key, value)[source]

Update the data with a new value and touch proxy file if key in proxy list.

Parameters:

  • key – Key for the data.

  • value – New value to set.

snapshot_push()[source]

Push the current state of the data to snapshot stack for undo functionality.

If the maximum number of snapshots is reached, the second-oldest snapshot is removed. The oldest is always retained for return to initial state.

snapshot_undo()[source]

Restore the data to the previous state using the snapshot stack.

The first snapshot remains in the stack to always allow undo to initial state.

warn(message)[source]
data_manager.touch_file(filename)[source]

Set the file’s modification and access time to the current time.

Parameters:

filename (str) – Path to the file.
